page.title: 06Events
page.content: BODELWYDDAN CASTLE continued This is a report from the local paper the Abergele Visitor the week after the first concert was given at the Hall. "The first concert in the new look hallwas on Satruday, 7th Sept. 1985 when the Rhyl Music Club launched a gala inaugural performance with American singers, Jo Ann Pickens and Donnie Ray Albert, accompanied by Antony Saunders." "This was voted a great success," Mr. J. Parr, Castle Administrator said, "organisers were delighted with the first concert and the support given by local people. We had a full Hall apart from 20 seats, and the only comments I had all evening were congratulatory. The artists received a standing ovation with their rendition of songs from Porgy and Bess proving to be the highlights of the evening."
